Key Match Events: The Cleveland Cavaliers pulled off a 129-122 win over the Oklahoma City Thunder.
Jarrett Allen led the Cavaliers with 25 points and six assists.
Evan Mobley contributed 18 points, 10 rebounds, and seven assists.
Dean Wade and Max Strus combined for 10 three-pointers.
Shea Gilgeous-Alexander scored 31 points for the Thunder.
A late fourth-quarter run by the Thunder cut the Cavaliers' lead to two points with about 1:30 to play.
An Allen tip-out on an Evan Mobley missed three-pointer helped seal the game for the Cavaliers.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavaliers have passed every possible test to this point in the season.
The Cavaliers' victory was seen as a statement win over the second-best team in the NBA.
The Cavaliers' performance was highlighted as not being a fluke and deserving of national respect.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers are now 32-4 on the season.
The game was considered a potential finals preview.
